xc THE DISCOVERER OF THE NORTH CAPE

OTHERE, the old sea-captain, - Who dwelt in Helgoland‚ To King Alfred, the Lover of Truth, Brought a snow-white walrus-tooth, Which he held in his brown right hand.

His figure was tall and stately, Like a boy's his eye appeared5

His hair was yellow as hay,

But threads of a silvery grey Gleamed in his tawny heard.

Hearty and hale was Othere‚

His cheek had the colour of oak3 With a kind of laugh in his speech, Like the sea-tide on a hezich,

As unto the king he spoke.

And Alfred, King of the Saxons, Had a book upon his knees, And wrote down the wondrous tale Of him who was first to sail Into the Aretic seas.

‘So far I live to the northward, No man lives north of me; To the east are wild mountain-chains, And beyond them meres and plains3 To the westward all is sea.
